column4: I have a dual boot (windows and ubuntu 10.04), is it possible to increase my disk space / partition to ubuntu?
I can't remember how, but the answer is yes, but its also dangerous
you could lose all sorts of windows things
- so the better method I guess would be to uninstall ubuntu, and install it again with bigger size?
did you already resize the windows partition ?
- I have not done anything yet.
so windows and ubuntu are on the same drive ? correect ?
- that is correct.
have you installed ubuntu already?
- yes,
- windows and ubuntu are running side by side.
then the harm is done already, does windows partition have tons of spare space ?
- yup, tons of space.
then I would just clean the drive, defrag and whatnot, and resize it,
- Initially I just wanted to test ubuntu... but now I am loving it very much that I want to use it more.
though its dangerous, keep in mind
if you just need space, I would suggest simply mounting the other partition.
- thanks
- what do you mean mounting the other partition?
- maybe that is just want I need?
yup, you just want access to the windows-side of the spare hd space, so don't resize ubuntu and windows
http://www.psychocats.net/ubuntu/mountwindows
that should start you off
- thanks.
